medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive somnolence and fever of 39Â°C over 24 hours, leading to agitation and a generalized seizure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to admission with malaise, followed by progressive somnolence and fever. The patient became agitated and developed a generalized seizure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A ventriculoperitoneal catheter was placed 25 years prior for a Chiari type I malformation with hydrocephalus. In 2008, underwent a lumbar puncture for acute headache with normal CSF parameters. Not vaccinated for mumps.
medical_history.family_history: Three close relatives were diagnosed with mumps.
